current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To prohibit unfair or deceptive acts or practices relating to the prices of products and services sold online, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Tallying of the Actual Liabilities Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Tallying of the Actual Liabilities Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Prohibition on certain unfair
			 or deceptive acts or practices relating to prices of products and services sold
			 online

text.#text: In this section, the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: has jurisdiction under

text.#text: over whom the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

section 5(a) of the Federal
			 Trade Commission Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Trade Commission Act/s:5/ss:a

text.#text:
whose business
			 includes selling products or services.

A retailer may not sell a product or a service
			 to a person through the use of an Internet website without presenting the
			 person with the total amount that the retailer expects to collect from the
			 person as part of the transaction of selling the product or service to the
			 person, including all fees, taxes, and shipping and handling charges, before
			 the person commits to purchasing the product or service.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

			 an unfair or deceptive act or practice described under
